methodology: Mapping prior art designs to k_edge parameter and checking if W_max is correctable (<100nm)

ASML_US8564925B2.description: Uniform electrostatic chuck with stress-balanced layers
ASML_US8564925B2.rationale: Patent focuses on electrostatic clamping, not radial density gradient

ASML_NL2022445A.description: Substrate support with uniform projection pins and e-pins
ASML_NL2022445A.rationale: Pin pattern is uniform, no mention of edge density variation

Nikon_JP2004006706A.description: Thermal stress reduction via chuck heating
Nikon_JP2004006706A.rationale: Addresses thermal stress via heating, not mechanical topology

conclusion: All known prior art (k_edge≈1.0) fails the correctability threshold. Our solution (k_edge≥2.0) is the minimum viable design for ROM-correctable deformation.
